alert.note: Alert for Lowndes; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 4:25PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lowndes and southern Montgomery Counties through 515 PM CST... At 425 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Davenport, or 7 miles northeast of Fort Deposit, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Deposit, Hayneville, Meadville, Pine Level, Strata, Dublin, Naftel, Logan, Sprague, Grady, Sellers, Davenport, Ramer, Lapine, Pintlala, Calhoun, Carters Hill, Letohatchee and Currys. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central and southeastern Alabama.
